alert.note: Alert for Absaroka Mountains; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains; Yellowstone National Park (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 3:00AM MST until February 21 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Periods of snow. Additional snowfall of 2 to 4 inches is possible. * WHERE...Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains, Yellowstone National Park and Absaroka Mountains. * WHEN...Now until 5 PM today. The heaviest snow has already occurred. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions, particularly across Teton and Togwotee Passes. Areas of blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Please monitor the Bridger-Teton Avalanche Center at JHAVALANCHE.ORG, if your plans include travel into the backcountry.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling and allow extra time to reach your destination. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Absaroka Mountains; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains; Yellowstone National Park
